greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = sum of the remainders when the n-th prime is divided by primes up to the (n-1)-th prime.
comment: Row sums of A207409. - _Bob Selcoe_, Apr 14 2014
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(5) = 8. The remainders when the fifth prime 11 is divided by 2, 3, 5, 7 are 1, 2, 1, 4, respectively and their sum = 8.
maple: f:= proc(n) local j;  add(P[n] mod P[j],j=1..n-1) end proc:
results.author: Armand Turpel (armandt(AT)unforgettable.com)
